result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Chaney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A Chaney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael A Chaney was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING February 19, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in BR. 36.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordeed.  Bail on deposit, if any, to apply.  Remainder to be paid during period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
-Restitution set at zero.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Chaney

records.addlTxt: Case is paid in full. vp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
   DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
As to count 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in cour for jury trial but the parties have reached a resolution.

As to Count 2:  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss Count 2 is granted by the Court without prejudice.

As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was recalled this p..
There is no spin court available.
Case adjourned for another jury trial date.
  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The parties are both ready to proceed.
The court will look for a spin court.
Case passed....

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  cab
 Final pretrial conference held.  Defendant rejects State's offer. Court informs parties all offers are off the table.  Case remains calendared on  09/14/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 36.

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Francisco Araiza. William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.J.R. DOB 12/5/96 and A.C.C.C. DOB 11/1/92.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael A Chaney in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Michael A Chaney in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
